lead_paragraph: The project, known as the Decentralized Autonomous Organization, is raising broader questions about the security and viability of virtual currencies like Ether and Bitcoin.

headline.print_headline: $50 Million Hacking May Scuttle a Virtual Currency Project
headline.main: A Hacking of More Than $50 Million Dashes Hopes in the World of Virtual Currency

snippet: The project, known as the Decentralized Autonomous Organization, is raising broader questions about the security and viability of virtual currencies like Ether and Bitcoin.
abstract: Hacker steals over $50 million of digital money from experimental virtual currency project known as Decentralized Autonomous Organization; crowdfunded venture had raised $160 million in form of Ether, alternative to digital currency Bitcoin; theft could scuttle project.
